be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.tree

Class Tree

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.tree.Tree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeIF

    public class Tree
extends java.lang.Object
implements TreeIF
    Generic definition of a decision tree

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tree

        public Tree(RandomSampler mtrySampler,
    java.lang.Class splittingCriterionClass,
    Data d,
    int[] inTree,
    int[] oob,
    InternalImportanceIF inImpOfForest,
    InternalImportanceIF variableCount,
    int maxDepth)
        Initializes a tree object with the following parameters
        Parameters:
        mtrySampler - a sampler used to randomly choose the candidate variables in each split
        splittingCriterionClass - the class according to which splits are decided
        d - the full dataset on which the ensemble is grown
        inTree - the indices of the samples of d from which this tree is grown
        oob - the indices of the samples of d that are not used to grow this tree
        inImpOfForest - an aggregator of variable importance, computed from the splitting criteria. This object should be common to all trees in the ensemble.
        variableCount - an object that records the number of times variables are used for splitting in the current tree. This object should be different for each tree.
        maxDepth - the maximal depth of this tree. A negative value will cause to fully grow the tree.

    • Method Detail

      • grow

        public void grow()
        Recursively grows the tree until one of those conditions is met:
        • samples cannot be separated
        • all samples are correctly classified
        • maximal depth is reached.
        In addition, the internal importance is updated in inImp object (see constructor).
        Specified by:
        grow in interface TreeIF

      • predict

        public int predict(double[] x)
        Description copied from interface: TreeIF
        Predicts the label of a p-dimensional sample.
        Specified by:
        predict in interface TreeIF
        Parameters:
        x - a sample to be predicted (in p dimensions)
        Returns:
        the estimated class label of x

      • getInTreeVariableCount

        public InternalImportanceIF getInTreeVariableCount()
        Returns:
        the aggregator which counts variables used in the current tree

      • getOob

        public int[] getOob()
        Description copied from interface: TreeIF
        The tree might be grown from a subset of the whole dataset. The data points not used during the tree induction form the out-of-bag (OOB). This methods returns the indices of OOB samples in an array.
        Specified by:
        getOob in interface TreeIF
        Returns:
        the indices of the OOB samples.

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Description copied from interface: TreeIF
        Computes the depth of the tree. The root node is at depth 0. A decision stump has a depth of 1.
        Specified by:
        getDepth in interface TreeIF
        Returns:
        tree depth

        Overrides:

      • getData

        public Data getData()
        Returns:
        the full data matrix on which the ensemble is grown

      • getSampleIds

        public int[] getSampleIds()
        Returns:
        the indices of the samples used to grow this tree

      • getMtryVars

        public int[] getMtryVars()
        Returns:
        the indices of the candidate variables considered in the root split of this tree

      • getMtrySampler

        public RandomSampler getMtrySampler()
        Returns:
        the sampler object used to randomly select the candidate variables in each split
